node.title: Migrant says truck was "speeding" before crash that killed dozens
node.description: The death toll stood at 53 by late Thursday, and authorities said at least 54 people had been injured.
node.content: ["Authorities are looking into whether speed was a factor into a deadly truck crash in southern Mexico. \u00a0", "A migrant from Guatemala said he was among 200 people aboard a cargo truck when the truck tried to make a sharp turn. The sheer weight of everyone inside and the speed that the truck was going caused the truck to tip over and roll\u2014crashing into a pedestrian bridge, according to the migrant. \u00a0", "\"The truck was speeding,\" he said. \u00a0", "The death toll stood at 53 by late Thursday, and authorities said at least 54 people had been injured.\u00a0", "Many on board were migrants from Guatemala and Honduras. According to first responders, there were many more aboard the vehicle who fled the scene for fear of being detained by immigration agents.\u00a0", "Survivors say migrants boarded the truck near the Guatemalan border and paid as much as $3,500 to be taken to central Mexico with the hopes of then heading to the U.S. border.\u00a0", "Many are fleeing poverty in Central America\u2014worsened by back-to-back hurricanes as CBS News reported from Guatemala earlier this year.\u00a0", "In April, CBS News spoke to a 19-year-old migrant who said he made it all the way to Mexico City before he ran out of money to pay smugglers.\u00a0", "The White House is urging migrants to stay in their homelands and just reinstated the \"Remain in Mexico\" policy for asylum seekers.\u00a0\u00a0But critics say tougher immigration policies are what force migrants to rely on smugglers to make the journey to the U.S, putting their lives at risk.\u00a0", "For Breaking News & Analysis Download the Free CBS News app"]
